Easily the best PC game this year. The graphics and sound have been improved greatly from the first game. As has the gameplay. Most of the puzzles aren't very difficult, but they're still satisfying to solve. 

The game also has a ton of great Easter eggs and helps to flesh out the back story to the Portal series. The game's storyline and ending will have you hooked and eagerly awaiting Portal 3.

I haven't had a chance to play the multiplayer yet, but if it's half as good as the single player this is potentially a game of the year game.
You will want to shoot a portal on every white surfaced wall you see until end of your life.

This game is the sequel of Portal and it sure is awesome!

The graphics were the only thing that was not improved because it uses the same version of source engine, but there were loads of new textures and items with different physics.

Great puzzles, totally enjoyed them. Very nice sound effects and spectacular environment design. A bunch of new features and a new character you will sure have fun with.

The thing i got most interested with was the story. Brilliant. Amazing analisis of how and why things are as they are. Implications about Half Life and Left 4 Dead were fun to experience. kept my interest up nonstop until i finished the game.

A great game if you're into puzzles, GLaDoS is still as jolly as ever and the Co-op is quite fun I'd give this game an 8.6 out of ten.

This game was truly an experience and is a work of art. It's fun, humorous and challenging all at the same time. This game will make you think, analyze and approach each test chamber in different ways. All of the characters in this game are dynamic which makes the story evolve in many different ways. It also makes the plot much more interesting for the player as they progress through Aperture.

Co-Op is also a nice feature as it allows players to solve test chambers that would be otherwise impossible to solve by oneself. This adds a new level of replayability that was not present in the original Portal. I highly recommend this game for its innovation, story and the fun that you'll have playing it.
Very fun game, great sense of humor and the cross-platform play between Steam and the PS3 works fantastic, just remember to go back to the title screen before shutting it off so it cloud syncs.

Portal était avant tout un projet expérimental, dont le succès n'était pas attendu par ses créateurs. Mais cette suite est bien plus ambitieuse, et à raison : le gameplay est toujours aussi bon (avec quelques petits ajouts agréables), l'ambiance est magnifique (A noter le passage dans l'ancien complexe aperture aux airs "Bioshockesques"), la bande son exemplaire (la VF est pour une fois excellente), et l'histoire, si elle n'est pas transcendante, se révèle efficace et dotée de personnages hauts en couleurs. Ajoutez à cela un mode coop des plus intelligents, et vous obtenez un petit bijou!
rozhodně vydařené pokračování s novými prvky, opět velmi vtipné. Multiplayer je díky coopu naprosto špičková zábava, GLaDOS háže vtipné hlášky, jen je to velmi krátké.

Nachdem ich es jetzt durchgespielt habe (Coop angetestet), kann kann ich behaupten, dass es für mich das Spiel des Jahres 2011 ist. Die Story wirkt nicht aufgesetzt, und man ist teils richtig gespannt, sich neues Wissen über die Entstehung und Arbeit von Aperture Science zu erspielen. Dabei schlägt man ganz neue Wege abseits der Testkammern ein, die ein gewisses Umdenken erfordern. Auch die Ergänzung der Rätselelemente sind sinnvoll und fordernd (Laser, Lichtbrücken, Prismenwürfel). Besonders zu erwähnen sind die Flüssigkeiten, die einfach Spaß machen. Die Rätsel sind (durch mehr Spielelemente) komplexer als noch im ersten Teil, es wirkt an keiner Stelle unfair oder überfordernd. Es gibt durchaus einige Kammern, in denen man durchaus festhängt, wenn man es dann schafft, hat man aber das Gefühl etwas geleistet zu haben. Nebenbei ist Portal 2 auch noch zum brüllen komisch. Fortlaufend. Bis zum Schluss. Kaufen!

This game is an instant classic that if you haven't tried, your really missing out on. Taking elements from the original portal and combining them with a compelling storyline and superb acting, this game is one that must not be missed!

"Portal was a test, Portal 2 is a game" - totally agreed. The original is still a classic, but the amount of new items, new scenarios, the story, everything is great! As I usually joke, "the only problem is that it ends" XD (and that it's hard to find a co-op partner)

I was skeptical, but this game is great. The single-player even has a plot which isn't half bad. Game is absolutely hilarious and a blast. Puzzles are well paced in terms of difficulty, you fly through them quickly, allowing for smoothe gameplay progression but it still maintains a sense of difficulty and feels rewarding. Music absolutely spot on, as usual with Valve. Co-op is obviously a blast! One of the best games of the year and a must buy! I was pleasantly surprised at how good this game is. Visuals are also good considering how old the Source engine is, but this isn't industry defining in terms of graphics. The only drawback the game has is that it is suffering MINOR consolitis. That is to say, there are a lot of load screens, a lot. They all loaded very quickly for me however, albeit I am running on Solid State Media. This is a minor issue, however, and doesn't take away from the game's overall appeal.
Well done. Here come the test results: "You are a tremendous game." That's what it says: a tremendous game. We weren't even testing for that.

If you liked the first game, this is pretty much what happens when you team up an amazingly clever game with dark humour, great mechanics and slick visuals, and drop a dump truck of money on the developers.
(I've not seen a sequel this good since Half-Life 2 or Team Fortress 2!)

What a strange blend of a game.

Portal 2 is one of the few games that starts epic, slows the pace, and then manages to pick it up again at exactly the right times. It seamlessly meshes a goofy background story with some rather serious themes, without ever appearing ridiculous. That in itself is no small feat.

The storyline is more cohesive than the original, making the player feel more immersed in the world. Giving cues on when to stop and stare, and when to frantically run, is the excellent soundtrack. It fits the entire universe perfectly. Then, of course, there's the tried and true gameplay we've come to expect from the original, with just enough new mechanics mixed in to keep it fresh. No need to fix what ain't broken.

Without ever having touched co-op, I can recommend Portal 2 without reservation. It takes the precedent set by the original, keeping and expanding on all the good, without trying to innovate too much and making the game feel cluttered or broken.

Portal 2 is a sequal to Portal 1 with a whole new style of gameplay. Between Portal 1 and Portal 2, Portal 1 is rated T and Portal 2 is rated E10+. Why u may ask, its because of the blood they put in Portal 1 so sorry for all u blood thirsty people. With the new Co-op mode it requires a lot of thinking especially when ur playing with a noob. This Game features: Chapter by Chapter story line, More Aperture science technology, More Achievements then Portal 1, More harder test chambers, and L4d2 and TF2 main menu format. Also in case if ur wondering "Will there be any cake?" well i got some good news and some bad news. Bad news is No there wont be any cake unfortunlly, Good news is Valve replace it with something better Potatoes, in case u dont get it, before Steam put The potato sack which is a bunch of indie games so yea that was an idea to put in the game. So if ur 1 of those guys that are thinking with portals then u must get this game.
Cost: $30

Nach Portal "musste" ich auch Portal 2 haben und was soll ich sagen... es ist toll²! Insbesondere im Coop-Modus habe ich viel Spaß gehabt, der zunächst gar nicht so einfach zu erfahren und daher auf den ersten Blick auch nicht attraktiv war. Warum ist das so? Nun, zunächst brauchte ich einen Partner, mit dem ich das Spiel auch zusammen spielen konnte. Klar, es gibt die Möglichkeit, mit einem zufälligen Spieler den Coop-Modus zu erleben. Aber an wen gerate ich da? Nachdem ich dann einen geeigneten Partner gefunden hatte, ging's endlich los und das war echt das zweite "toll", was ich vergeben kann.
Wenn's günstiger geworden ist, werden vielleicht noch ein paar weitere Spieler damit loslegen; für jegliche Coop-Erlebnisse bin ich gerne zu haben, die Zeit muss eben passen.
Fazit: Sowohl im Singleplayer, als auch im Coop ist Portal 2 gelungen und eine klare Empfehlung meinerseits!

Portal 1 was amazing! Innovative, mind bending, fun, and most everyone still wanted more after we we're done. Enter Portal 2, no huge innovations, but why mess with such an already new success?

Portal 2 does add an awesome, albeit short, 2-player mode for even more complex puzzles, and  fun. Portal 2 has wit, humor, & an incredible voice cast which makes this game worth playing alone.  The added portals & added puzzle pieces are just icing on the cake.

Portal, ponto. Essas duas palavras seriam suficientes para recomendar este jogo. Portal 2 volta à Aperture após inúmeros anos, quem sabe séculos, e retorna à jogabilidade com portais. Agora adicionando Wheatley na trama, você se sente menos "forever alone against GLaDOS", apesar de algumas reviravoltas durante o jogo. Os diálogos ainda são o maior atrativo, pelo menos por minha parte, e os quebra-cabeças, assim como ideias de uso do portal são totalmente bem feitas em Portal 2. Gráficos excelentes e jogabilidade perfeita. Por fim, o Co-Op extende e muito a vida útil do jogo, pois a campanha principal é, assim como o primeiro, mais ou menos curta (sou suspeito pra falar pois eu zerei em 2 dias) . A Valve prometeu para o verão de 2011 mais DLC, porém até o momento em que foi feita essa recomendação, não houve nenhum pronunciamento por parte dela. Realmente uma obra de arte. Recomendo.
U BETTER GET THIS GAME GUYS

A worthy followup to an already all time classic game. As some reviewer put it: “Leave it to Valve to add more personality to an insane A.I system, two robot test subjects, generic turrets and a cube than in most human video game protagonists this generation.”

99/100 for being THE Game of the Year, for its story, voice acting, humor, characters, unique puzzles, game play, etc. That being said, this is a must buy for anyone that loved the first Portal game or any other Valve games such as the Half Life series (which also takes place in the same universe / story). Although the single player campaign is only about 10 – 15 hours long depending on how good you are at solving puzzles, it definitely felt like the correct length. Furthermore, Portal 2 has co-op which adds cross platform play and an additional 5 – 10 hours of game play, which continues the story following the events of Portal 2 single player. Finally, as far as the story is concerned, the game answered almost all of my questions about Chell, Aperture Science, etc. Though we may not see a Portal 3, I have a good feeling that Half Life 3 will be here soon and I hope that we see Chell again someday!

11/10
